title: LLM-based Generative Error Correction for Rare Words with Synthetic Data and Phonetic Context
author: Natsuo Yamashita (Hitachi, Ltd.), Masaaki Yamamoto (Hitachi, Ltd.), Hiroaki Kokubo (Hitachi, Ltd.), Yohei Kawaguchi (Hitachi, Ltd.), ...
relevance_why: This paper is relevant to Haohe Liu's research as it presents a novel approach to improving speech recognition, specifically in handling rare words using Generative Error Correction models, which can be beneficial for audio quality enhancement and restoration tasks.
background: This research develops a method to enhance automatic speech recognition systems by correcting transcription errors, particularly focusing on rare words through synthetic data generation and phonetic contextual integration.
contribution: This paper introduces a generative model approach that synthesizes error-pair data to effectively correct errors in ASR outputs, achieving improved word and character error rates across English and Japanese datasets.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods often rely solely on textual information or lack sufficient data for rare words, leading to over-correction or poor performance in specialized contexts.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances existing methods by generating synthetic data for training and incorporating phonetic context to improve correction accuracy.

key_innovation: Focuses on the integration of phonetic information alongside textual inputs, utilizing simplified phonetic representations to avoid over-correction.
real_world_impact: By improving the accuracy of speech recognition systems, this research can contribute to more reliable voice-activated interfaces and accessibility tools, potentially enhancing user experience in various real-world applications.
limitations: No specific limitations are mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.Generative Error Correction: **Generative Error Correction** refers to the use of generative models, particularly large language models, to identify and correct errors in transcriptions produced by automatic speech recognition systems.
new_terms.phonetic context: **Phonetic context** involves utilizing phonetic representations of speech to provide additional cues for better understanding and correction of spoken input.

open_sourcing: The paper mentions that rare word lists used in the evaluation have been publicly released.
